payload.question: How do I design a secure API?
payload.answer: Combine constant-time token comparison, rate limiting per identity, and strict input validation at the trust boundary. Use short-lived tokens with rotation; validate and sanitize all input; never trust client data.

citations.0x08cf1986678b5cc57743c44f55e9bbb536dc0c: Use constant-time comparison when comparing tokens, secrets, or hashes.
citations.0x2ddc4f65486df9a7c827d668a01fe832c73176: Apply rate limits per identity to prevent brute-force and abuse.
citations.0x0bd7c20d0fdccdc54e8b7cfd8e6d7ca06dc2be: Validate and sanitize all input at the trust boundary; use allowlists over blocklists.
